title: Chicken a la King 白汁雞皇飯
steps: Cut chicken thigh into bite size pieces (butterfly-cut the meat if it is thick), and marinate it for 20 minutes.
Wipe the mushrooms with wet towel, or peel the mushroom skin, before slicing them.
Chop carrots and potatoes into chunks. Cook them in boiling water until they are semi-softened. Drain and set aside.
Melt the butter in a pan. When it starts bubbling, add all purpose flour and keep stirring it at low heat.
When it starts to release a buttery/cakey smell, add cold cream and chicken stock, and stir for 1-2 minutes.
Add chicken thigh, carrots and potatoes into the sauce and mix well. Add more chicken stock if need to. Put a lid on and cook for 5 minutes at low heat.
Check that the sauce has simmered and thickened. If you get some sauce onto a spoon, and wipe it off with a finger. If the liquid doesn't close the gap, the sauce has the right consistency.
Add mushrooms and peas, and cooked with the lid on for 1-2 minutes.
Add some salt to taste and serve.
